title: Pak's Dar reveals how India firmly rejected any US involvement in dialogue
content: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar acknowledged India's refusal of third-party mediation for the ceasefire established on May 10. Dar stated that India insists on bilateral talks, a stance reiterated during a meeting in Washington. He emphasized Pakistan's openness to dialogue, while noting India's reluctance.

title: Asia Cup row: BJP targets Rahul over Afridi's remarks; Cong hits back with old pic
content: The Asia Cup handshake controversy escalated after India skipped the customary exchange with Pakistan, drawing political reactions. Shahid Afridi criticised PM Modi, praising Rahul Gandhi, while BJP's Amit Malviya questioned Gandhi's loyalties. The PCB filed a complaint with the ICC, alleging misconduct by the match referee, and threatened withdrawal from the Asia Cup 2025.

title: 'Go beyond traditional war concept': Rajnath to forces; flags 'unconventional threats'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, addressing the Combined Commanders’ Conference 2025, urged the Armed Forces to prepare for modern warfare, including information and biological threats. He emphasized technology adoption and self-reliance, calling for a 'Sudarshan Chakra' strategy. Singh highlighted the 'JAI' mantra (Jointness, Aatmanirbharta, Innovation) for military modernization and cited Operation Sindoor as an example of India's growing indigenous capabilities.

title: 'Masood Azhar's family torn into pieces': JeM commander's big admission on Op Sindoor
content: Jaish-e-Mohammad commander Masood Ilyas Kashmiri admitted in a video that India's Operation Sindoor severely impacted Maulana Masood Azhar's family. The strike on May 7 targeted terror infrastructure in Bahawalpur, JeM's headquarters, following the deadly Pahalgam attack where 26 civilians were killed. India retaliated by destroying major terror hubs and air infrastructure across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: AI predictions: Zoom CEO agrees with Bill Gates, Jensen Huang; ‘3-day work week coming’
content: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan joins other tech leaders in predicting AI will revolutionize productivity, potentially leading to a three-day workweek. Yuan emphasizes that AI's rapid evolution will enable people to achieve the same results with less effort, echoing sentiments shared by Bill Gates and Jensen Huang.

title: Exclusive: R Ashwin poised for ILT20 stint with possible player-coach role
content: Ravichandran Ashwin may soon be seen in the ILT20 League. ILT20 CEO David White has expressed strong interest in having Ashwin play. White highlighted Ashwin's exceptional talent and cricket intellect. Ashwin has retired from the IPL and is keen to explore opportunities in other leagues. He is also open to coaching roles. Ashwin has registered for overseas leagues.

title: 23-year-old TikToker dead: She was reported missing; dies weeks after posting clown video
content: Fashion influencer Marian Izaguirre, known for her 4.1 million TikTok followers, has tragically passed away in a Morelia, Mexico hospital. The 23-year-old was found in critical condition at a hotel on September 6, days after being reported missing. Her death, attributed to fatal health complications leading to brain death, has prompted tributes from fans and fellow creators.

title: Vijay’s TVK slams Shah for Hindi 'imposition'; terms it against federalism
content: Actor Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) has strongly condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks promoting Hindi, viewing it as an imposition that undermines federalism. The party argues that prioritizing Hindi in government administration disregards the nation's linguistic diversity and goes against the spirit of inclusivity. TVK urges Shah to retract his statement emphasizing Hindi's role in a self-reliant India.

title: Class 10 exams twice a year: Sports students covered under May session; no separate paper
content: Beginning in 2026, the CBSE will accommodate student-athletes under the new two-board-exam system for Class 10. The sports exam accommodation aligns with the second board exam in May, addressing date clashes between sporting events and academic assessments. This provision ensures students can manage both sports and studies effectively, with re-exams available if needed.

title: Google’s Nano Banana AI: Saree edits take over Instagram; 5 mistakes to avoid
content: The internet is abuzz with the Google Gemini Nano Banana AI saree trend, enabling users to transform selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits. These viral edits feature chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, achieved through precise AI prompts.

title: Maharashtra local body polls: Hold elections by January, orders SC
content: The Supreme Court has mandated the Maharashtra government and State Election Commission to conduct local body elections by January 31, 2026. The court has instructed authorities to complete the delimitation exercise by October 10 this year.

title: Two-thirds of Americans link harsh political talk to violence: Poll
content: A recent Reuters poll reveals that a significant majority of Americans believe harsh political rhetoric is fueling violence, following the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. The poll highlights concerns about eroded tolerance, a sense of societal breakdown, and fears of politically motivated violence. There's also a disparity in media attention given to different incidents of political violence.

title: Mother Dairy price cut: Revised rates effective from Sept 22
content: Mother Dairy will reduce prices on most value-added dairy and processed food products starting September 22, 2025, passing on 100% of the GST benefits to consumers. This decision follows the GST Council's rationalization of tax slabs, aiming to boost consumption and make packaged foods more affordable.

title: No Neeraj! Two Indians to compete against Nadeem - Here's why
content: Neeraj Chopra begins his World Championship title defence, facing strong rivals like Arshad Nadeem and Julian Weber. The competition features a historic four Indian athletes. Chopra aims to join an elite group of javelin throwers, while Weber enters as a favourite based on current form. The anticipated Chopra-Nadeem clash is set for the final round.

title: 'No confusion': Tejashwi says CM face to be named at 'right time'; cites 'people's mandate'
content: Tejashwi Yadav, amidst his 'Bihar Adhikar Yatra,' asserted the Mahagathbandhan alliance faces no confusion regarding its chief ministerial candidate for the upcoming Bihar assembly election. He emphasized that the people of Bihar desire change and will ultimately decide who leads the state.

title: Nasa’s Guardian detects tsunami: 30-minute early warning; a space-based breakthrough
content: In July 2025, NASA's Guardian system detected a tsunami triggered by a massive earthquake near Kamchatka. Utilizing atmospheric disturbances and GNSS signals, Guardian issued alerts up to 30 minutes before landfall. This experimental technology enhances traditional warning systems, offering near-real-time, global monitoring and marking a significant advancement in disaster preparedness.

title: 'I love you two': LeBron James’ mother pens emotional message for her son
content: LeBron James and Savannah James recently celebrated their 12th wedding anniversary, prompting an emotional message from LeBron's mother, Gloria James. Gloria expressed her love and blessings for the couple, who are parents to Bronny, Bryce Maximus, and Zhuri Nova.

title: Rs 579.06 crore! Apollo Tyre to sponsor Indian team; outbid Canva, JK Cement
content: Apollo Tyres has secured the Indian cricket team's jersey sponsorship until 2027, committing approximately Rs 4.5 crores per game, surpassing Dream11's previous rate. The deal encompasses around 130 fixtures. Canva and JK Cement were also in contention, while Birla Optus Paints showed interest but avoided bidding. Dream11's exit was triggered by the government's online gaming regulations.

title: UAE Lottery: How to play and win up to Dh60,000
content: The UAE Lottery has launched Colour Prediction, a fast-paced online game with draws every minute and prizes up to Dh60,000. Players can pick numbers or colours starting at Dh1. This follows July’s launch of Gemstone Riches and Sports Mania. The platform is regulated, promotes responsible play, and is open only to players aged 18 and above.

title: Pak PM likely to meet Trump; talks expected on UNGA sidelines - Report
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and Army Chief Asim Munir, recently promoted to Field Marshal, are reportedly meeting with US President Donald Trump on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. This follows a prior White House luncheon between Trump and Munir, where discussions included the Iran-Israel conflict and potential US-Pakistan trade partnerships.

title: Haryanvi actor and filmmaker Uttar Kumar arrested in alleged rape case
content: Uttar Kumar, a Haryanvi actor and filmmaker, is in police custody. A 25-year-old colleague accused him of r*pe and intimidation. The woman attempted suicide outside the Chief Minister's residence in Lucknow. She alleged inaction by authorities. The complainant stated harassment began in 2020. She filed a complaint, but alleges police mishandled the case.

title: 'Andy Pycroft masla nahi hai': Ex-Pakistan cricketer says PCB messed up
content: Former cricketer Rashid Latif criticises the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) approach to the handshake controversy, arguing they are misdirecting their focus by targeting match referee Andy Pycroft. Latif emphasises that a handshake isn't mandatory according to ICC regulations.

title: Once the fastest! Usian Bolt now struggles on stairs, says 'not a fan' of running now
content: Usain Bolt, the retired sprinting icon, made a rare appearance in Tokyo, recreating his signature pose. He now enjoys a relaxed life with family, movies, and Lego, while still holding world records. Bolt believes his generation was faster, emphasizing the importance of natural talent over technology, and encourages current athletes to be authentic with fans.

title: Kerala: 2 government employees among 14 accused of raping boy; 9 arrested
content: In Kerala's Kasaragod, a disturbing case has emerged involving the sexual assault of a 16-year-old boy. Nine individuals, including two government employees, have been arrested. The victim was allegedly abused over two years by 14 men he met on a gay dating app, with incidents occurring at his home and in Kannur and Kozhikode.

title: ITR filing due date today: Tax portal still facing glitches? What taxpayers are saying
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25 due day extension: Taxpayers are reportedly facing persistent technical issues on the Income Tax e-filing portal even after the Finance Ministry extended the ITR filing deadline to September 16, 2025. Despite scheduled maintenance, users reported problems with submission, late fee reflections, and portal functionality.

title: How Saudi Arabia is attracting sports icons like Tom Brady and Cristiano Ronaldo
content: Saudi Arabia is rapidly emerging as a global sports hub, attracting major stars with lucrative deals and high-profile events. Cristiano Ronaldo's move to Al Nassr fueled the Saudi Pro League's growth, while events like Formula 1 races and WWE shows draw international attention. Vision 2030 aims to boost the sports market to $22.

title: Online betting scam: ED summons Yuvraj Singh, Robin Uthappa, actor Sonu Sood
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned former cricketers Robin Uthappa and Yuvraj Singh, along with actor Sonu Sood, for questioning in a money laundering case related to the alleged illegal online betting app 1xBet. They are scheduled to appear next week under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

title: From ice cream to hamburgers: Words Kim Jong Un has banned
content: Kim Jong Un's government in North Korea has banned the term 'ice cream'. The government replaced it with state-approved terms. This is part of a campaign to remove foreign words. Tourism guides are trained to avoid Anglicised words. 'Hamburger' is now 'double bread with ground beef'. The policy aims to strengthen North Korean expressions. It also eliminates outside cultural influence.

title: Roads blocked, vehicles swept away: Cloudburst in Himachal, Uttarakhand
content: Heavy rain, cloudbursts, and landslides have caused widespread destruction in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand. In Himachal Pradesh, three people died in Mandi district due to a landslide. Uttarakhand was hit by a cloudburst in Dehradun, damaging properties and infrastructure. Rescue operations are underway, and authorities are providing assistance to those affected, with the Chief Ministers monitoring the situation.

title: Who is Nupur Bora? Assam officer accused of illegal transfer of Hindus’ land
content: Assam Civil Service officer Nupur Bora has been arrested in connection with a corruption scandal involving illegal land transfers and disproportionate assets. Raids on her residences in Guwahati uncovered nearly Rs 1 crore in cash, diamonds, and jewellery. The investigation was triggered by complaints of unexplained wealth and questionable land transactions, particularly in Barpeta district.

title: 'Our board can't afford': Pakistan unlikely to withdraw from Asia Cup
content: ​​The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is unlikely to withdraw from the Asia Cup 2025, despite rising tensions over the role of match referee Andy Pycroft during Pakistan’s match against India in Dubai on Sunday. Match referee Pycroft had asked Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha and Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav to skip the customary handshake at the toss.

title: Tom Brady accused of breaking rules as NFL deletes viral clip of headset controversy
content: Tom Brady's presence in the Las Vegas Raiders' coaches' booth during a Monday Night Football game against the Chargers has ignited controversy. Wearing a headset and conferring with the offensive staff, including Chip Kelly, Brady's involvement raised questions about fairness and potential rule violations, especially given his part-ownership of the team and upcoming broadcasting role covering other NFL teams.

title: 'Torturing' Pak through match referee: Ex-player uses distasteful language for Surya
content: Mohammad Yousuf, the former Pakistani batter, sparked controversy by using disrespectful language towards India's Suryakumar Yadav during a panel discussion. He also accused the Indian cricket board of exerting undue influence, citing the Asia Cup handshake incident. The ICC rejected PCB's demand to remove the match referee, further fuelling the tensions after India's victory.

title: Fraud case: Raj Kundra questioned for 5 hours; what businessman said
content: Raj Kundra, husband of Shilpa Shetty, is under investigation for a Rs 60 crore fraud. He told Mumbai Police that Bipasha Basu and Neha Dhupia received fees from the disputed amount. Investigators found fund transfers to several actresses, including Shilpa Shetty. Suspicious transactions occurred during demonetisation. Police plan to re-examine 'Best Deal' videos.

title: Saudi Arabia’s central bank launches Google Pay and announces Alipay+ acceptance by 2026
content: Google Pay has officially launched in Saudi Arabia via the national Mada network, enabling secure digital transactions. SAMA also announced Alipay+ acceptance by 2026, enhancing cross-border payments. These moves align with Vision 2030 goals to boost financial inclusion and reduce cash use. Saudi’s fintech sector has surged, attracting $2.39 billion in investments and achieving 79% electronic retail payments.

title: 'Interest-free for all': Nitish Kumar on student credit card loans; what it means for Bihar
content: The Bihar government has announced that education loans under the Student Credit Card (SCC) scheme will now be interest-free for all students. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar also revealed an extension in the repayment period, from five to seven years for loans up to Rs 2 lakh, and up to ten years for larger loans. The move aims to ease financial stress and promote higher education access across the state.

title: 'If you come illegally ... ': US DHS warns after Indian-origin man beheaded
content: Following the brutal beheading of Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah in Dallas, DHS issued a warning about the risks posed by criminal illegal immigrants. Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national, allegedly committed the crime after being released into the US. President Trump condemned the killing, criticizing the Biden administration's immigration policies and vowing strict action against criminal illegal immigrants.

title: India’s 1st private strategic oil reserve! Rs 5,700cr project in works; why it’s important
content: Megha Engineering has secured a Rs 5,700 crore contract to build and manage India's first private strategic petroleum reserve in Padur, Karnataka. This 2.5 MMT facility will significantly boost India's energy security, supplementing the existing reserves.

title: BMW crash: FIR contradicts DCP's statement, claims counsel
content: In the Delhi BMW accident case near Dhaula Kuan, the accused's lawyer, Vikas Pahwa, claims the FIR contradicts the DCP's statement. Gaganpreet Kaur, the driver, is in judicial custody after the accident resulted in one death and one injury.

title: Raid on Assam civil servant tied to ‘illegal transfer of Hindus’ land’
content: Assam bureaucrat Nupur Bora, a 2019-batch ACS officer, has been arrested for alleged corruption involving illegal land transfers in Barpeta, where the government is targeting suspected Bangladeshi settlers. Raids on her properties revealed nearly ₹1 crore in cash and valuable jewelry. CM Sarma stated that Bora was under investigation for transferring land to a specific community and hoarding disproportionate assets.

title: Brady shown in Raiders' coaching booth on MNF
content: Raiders minority owner Tom Brady was seen wearing a headset in the team's coaching booth during Monday's game vs. the Chargers.

title: Phillies clinch NL East with wild win vs. Dodgers
content: Kyle Schwarber, Weston Wilson and Bryce Harper homered, and the Phillies wrapped up their second straight National League East title with a thrilling 6-5 victory over the Dodgers on Monday night.

title: Geno's 3 picks squash Raiders' chances in loss
content: Geno Smith threw for three interceptions and no touchdowns in Monday night's loss to the Chargers, earning the Raiders QB a passer rating of 37.

title: Chargers' Mack set for tests on elbow after exit
content: Chargers linebacker Khalil Mack was ruled out of Monday's 20-9 win over the Raiders after sustaining an elbow injury in the first half that appeared to leave him in significant pain.

title: Commanders' Daniels has knee injury, status iffy
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels has a knee injury that has his status for Sunday's game against the Las Vegas Raiders in question.

title: Sources: Vikes' McCarthy (ankle) out 2-4 weeks
content: Vikings QB J.J. McCarthy is expected to miss two to four weeks with a high ankle sprain, sources told ESPN, and Carson Wentz is expected to start in his place.

title: LSU's Kelly apologizes to reporter for tirade
content: SU coach Brian Kelly apologized for snapping at a reporter following Saturday's 20-10 victory against Florida.

title: Netflix: Crawford win vs. Canelo watched by 41M
content: Over 41 million viewers tuned in to Netflix for the undisputed super middleweight title fight Saturday night that saw Terence Crawford dethrone Canelo Alvarez, the streaming service announced Monday.

title: 🏀 NBA Future Power Ranks: Where is your team?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Herbert controls game in Chargers' win over Raiders
content: After a slow start, the Chargers settled in, and the Raiders' QB Geno Smith threw three interceptions.

title: The biggest success -- and biggest failure -- for all 30 MLB teams this season
content: Whether your favorite team is headed to October or headed home, all clubs have had something go right ... and wrong.

title: Four rivals, 13 days: Five things we learned from Yankees' epic September stretch
content: New York went 7-5 against Houston, Toronto, Detroit and Boston. Did it teach us anything for October?

title: Why don't all teams use the unstoppable tush push? Do Eagles have a 'secret ingredient'?
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on a fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: How farming and family forged Eagles center Cam Jurgens
content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

title: College Football Playoff Bubble Watch: Breaking down every conference
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Ranking the Champions League field: Can anyone stop PSG or Barcelona?
content: It's Year 2 of the UEFA Champions League's new format, and it's Year 4 of Ryan O'Hanlon ranking the full field of teams. So let's get into it before Matchday 1.

title: Bond beyond basketball: Longtime friends Ogwumike, Diggins hope to extend Storm's season
content: Skylar Diggins and Nneka Ogwumike dreamed of playing together, but playoff success in Seattle has been elusive.

title: On the brink of playoff elimination, Fever are banking on resilience in Game 2
content: The season hasn't gone as planned, but Indiana has built fortitude it hopes will be enough to force a Game 3.

title: Joe Burrow out: What it means for the QB, Bengals
content: Cincinnati will be without its quarterback for three months after Burrow was ruled out with turf toe.

title: Pickups: Daniel Jones among top options to replace Joe Burrow
content: Highlighting available QBs for those who roster Burrow, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 3.

title: Buzz: Hunter plays both ways, Judkins debuts, Burrow injury and more from Sunday
content: Travis Hunter was pressed into extra DB service, the Bengals win with Jake Browning and more Sunday takeaways

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: ESPN is excited to present the first annual Wrestlepalooza on Saturday. Check out how to watch John Cena, Seth Rollins and other WWE stars.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Crawford takes over super middleweight; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford's win over Canelo Alvarez reshapes the 168-pound division. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Barnwell picks apart three wild Week 2 endings, from the Cowboys' big kick to the Jaguars' collapse
content: Bill Barnwell sorts through fourth-quarter fireworks in Giants-Cowboys, Broncos-Colts and Jaguars-Bengals.

title: Takeaways from every game: More Baker magic, Khalil Mack hurt in Chargers win
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: Carvajal's battle with Alexander-Arnold could spur Madrid to glory
content: Dani Carvajal won't give up his right-back spot to Trent Alexander-Arnold without a fight -- a situation that might actually work in Real Madrid's favor.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United open to Ugarte exit, Serie A clubs keen
content: Manchester United's Manuel Ugarte is wanted by clubs in Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: Wayanad landslides rehabilitation project will meet January 2026 deadline: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan
content: He informs Assembly that the construction of the township on 64.4705 hectares of land acquired by the government from Elstone Estate is progressing rapidly.  A total of 104 beneficiaries opted for financial assistance to reside outside the township, and each of them has been given an assistance of ₹15 lakh. Another 295 beneficiaries have opted for houses.

title: TTD making elaborate arrangements for  Brahmotsavams beginning September 24, says Chairman B.R. Naidu
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu will present a pair of silk ‘vastrams’ to the deity on behalf of the government, he says; the trust board also decides to construct 1,000 temples in Dalit localities across Andhra Pradesh

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Madras High Court closes suo motu case against former T.N. Minister Ponmudy’s derogatory speech
content: Justice N. Sathish Kumar grants liberty to the complainants to approach jurisdictional magistrates challenging the closure of their complaints by the police

title: ‘Magic Drain’ shows promise in rural sanitation at Somavaram
content: The pilot project is a low-cost, eco-friendly alternative to the conventional concrete drains; built using trenches lined with layers of graded stones and soak pits, the system allows household wastewater to filter naturally into the soil

title: Penalties will be imposed on those who fail to cooperate in controlling dengue: Mandya DC
content: Notices will be issued to property owners to take appropriate action if stagnant water from where dengue-causing mosquitoes breed is found

title: Kerala Societies Registration Bill, 2025, which envisions unified  legislation for societies, presented in Kerala Assembly
content: The proposed law seeks to replace the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (No. 21), applicable to the old Malabar region, and the Travancore-Cochin Literary, Scientific and Charitable Societies Act, 1955 (Act XII of 1955), applicable to the old Travancore-Cochin region

title: Mauritius occupies special place in India’s ‘Neighbourhood First’ policy: President Murmu
content: Mauritius PM Ramgoolam also met Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan, the first foreign dignitary to call on him after he was elected to the post earlier this month

title: Defence Minister to hoist national flag to mark Telangana Liberation Day at Parade Grounds in Secunderabad
content: He would also unveil the statue of Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee at the Cantonment Park near Jubilee Bus Station

title: India resilient to navigate global turbulences, more crude coming from Western Hemisphere: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Puri
content: India’s oil sector finds itself mired in a geopolitical setting triggered by U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff regime imposed in July amid concerns over its procurement of Russian oil

title: Himachal’s education push: Literacy rate over 99%; fewer than 57,000 left illiterate
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu credits Vyavastha Parivartan initiative and English-medium schooling for milestone

title: Tamil Nadu inks MoU with France’s Centre-Val de Loire
content: The understanding is aimed at facilitating the easy exchange, travel and associations of artists, cultural organisations and establishments between Tamil Nadu and Centre-Val de Loire

title: JD(S) leader Nikhil Kumaraswamy demands ₹25,000 per acre compensation for rain-hit farmers in Karnataka
content: Accusing the State Government of being all about announcements with zero delivery on the ground., he said that either the treasury is empty or the government does not have the will to act

title: Gujarat court issues notices to two journalists on Adani Group’s defamation complaint
content: Adani Group accused Abhisar Sharma, a YouTuber, and Raju Parulekar, a blogger, of spreading false and defamatory content to malign its reputation

title: Property dispute between spouses can be dealt only by Family Courts: Madras HC
content: Justice P.B. Balaji holds that no district court or any other subordinate civil court can entertain suits regarding a property dispute between husband and wife

title: ‘Last concession’: Supreme Court orders conduct of Maharashtra local body polls by January 31, 2026
content: The top court further directed the State Election Commission to complete the ongoing delimitation exercise by October 31, 2025, and said it could not be cited to delay the polls

title: Kochi cyber police arrest woman in ₹25 crore cyber fraud
content: This is the first arrest in the scam in which a Kochi-based businessperson was duped into engaging in stock trading promising high returns

title: Supreme Court seeks reply from States on pleas for staying anti-conversion laws
content: The bench was hearing petitions challenging the constitutional validity of anti-conversion laws enacted by several States

title: Karnataka High Court annuls Malur MLA Nanjegowda’s election, orders recount of votes
content: However, acting on a plea by Nanjegowda’s counsel, the High Court has put its own order on hold for 30 days.

title: 18 youths rescued from floodwaters of Penna River in Nellore
content: The youngsters were rescued in a seven-hour joint operation by police, fire and revenue department officials

title: Devotees don't offer money to temples for setting up marriage halls: Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court rules temple funds are not for marriage halls, suggests charitable use; case to be heard on November 19

title: K-FON to provide 2.5 lakh connections by next year, says Kerala Chief Minister
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan dismisses complaints that K-FON has very limited internet speed and that its customer service is poor and says that all such problems are being resolved

title: Nagpur Flyover Cuts Through House Balcony; Highway Body Claims Encroachment
content: A viral video from Nagpur shows an under-construction flyover slicing through the balcony of a residential building, raising eyebrows over urban planning.

title: TTV Dhinakaran Calls EPS A "Liar", Reminds Him Of 2017 No-Confidence Motion
content: Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam general secretary TTV Dhinakaran, who was expelled from the AIADMK, lashed out at Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS), calling him a "liar".

title: When PM Modi Gave 'Life Lesson' To Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat
content: Gajendra Singh Shekhawat recalled an experience from 2017 when he met PM Modi and discussed an issue related to his constituency.

title: "Pray To Lord Vishnu": Top Court Refuses To Hear Plea To Restore Beheaded Khajuraho Idol
content: The Supreme Court has refused to entertain a petition seeking restoration of a 7-foot beheaded idol of Lord Vishnu at the Javari temple -- part of the Khajuraho group of monuments in Madhya Pradesh

title: Bhupesh Baghel's Son Handled Rs 1000-Crore Of 'Liquor Scam' Proceeds: Probe Agency
content: Chaitanya Baghel, son of former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, was at the helm of the syndicate behind the "liquor scam" in Chhattisgarh and personally handled nearly Rs 1,000 crore generated from it, the ED has alleged

title: Class 9 Girl Dies By Suicide After Alleged Rape By UP Trainee Cop
content: A Class 9 student ended her life after allegedly being raped by a trainee constable who lived in her neighbourhood, officials said on Tuesday.

title: "True Leader Is One Who...": JP Nadda Shares Life Lesson By PM Modi
content: Union Minister Jagat Prakash Nadda has shared how Prime Minister Narendra Modi taught him that true political leadership lies in listening to the people.

title: "New Fanboy": BJP's Taunt After Shahid Afridi Praises Rahul Gandhi
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi has praised Rahul Gandhi, giving fresh ammunition to the ruling BJP to target the Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha.

title: UP Man Kills Nephew Over Blackmail, Burns Body in Drum: Cops
content: A man has been arrested for allegedly killing his nephew by strangulation, stuffing the body into a drum, and setting it on fire in Agra's Malpura area after being blackmailed over his minor daughter's photographs, police said on Tuesday.

title: Uttar Pradesh Orders 'Life Imprisonment' For Stray Dogs Who Bite Humans Twice
content: In an unprecedented order, the state government has said dogs that bite a human without provocation once will be kept at an animal centre for 10 days and those that repeat the act will be kept there for the rest of their life.

title: How Much For Matcha? Prices For Popular Powdered Tea Soar Due To Global Demand
content: Global demand for matcha has skyrocketed around the world, fueled by consumer interest in its health benefits.

title: Taliban Bans Wi-Fi In Afghan Province To 'Prevent Immorality'
content: The Taliban leader banned fibre optic internet in an Afghan province to "prevent immorality," a spokesman for the administration said Tuesday.

title: Rs 2 Crore Cash Seized In Pre-Dawn Raid On Telangana Government Employee
content: An estimated Rs 2 crore in cash was recovered from the home and properties linked to an Assistant Divisional Engineer (ADE) in the Telangana Electricity Department during an early morning raid by the Anti-Corruption Bureau on Tuesday.

title: Queen Camilla To Miss Royal Funeral Due To Illness
content: Queen Camilla pulled out of attending the Duchess of Kent's funeral to recover from acute sinusitis on Tuesday, Buckingham Palace announced just hours before US President Donald Trump was...

title: 'Pulled Children From Rubble In Pieces': Israel Pummels Gaza City
content: As drones buzzed overhead in the morning sun, Palestinians gently lifted from the rubble a blanket holding a body, the latest casualty of Israel's relentless bombardment of Gaza City.

title: Nepal Counts Cost After Deadly Protests
content: Nepal is assessing the multi-million dollar damage from last week's violent protests, when parliament, government offices and a newly opened Hilton Hotel were set ablaze.

title: Japan Political Party To Install AI Leader
content: An upstart Japanese political party said it will install an artificial intelligence as leader after its maverick founder quit following a disastrous showing in recent elections.

title: 8 Meghalaya Ministers Resign Ahead Of Cabinet Reshuffle
content: Ahead of a reshuffle in the Meghalaya cabinet to be held later on Tuesday, eight of the total 12 ministers, including senior leaders AL Hek, Paul Lyngdoh and Ampareen Lyngdoh, have resigned from their posts, officials said.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Israel Faces The Consequences Of Striking America's Friends
content: But, will anything change on the ground? If one were to read the Middle Eastern coffee cup right now, it might reveal that soon enough, things would go back to as they were before the strikes on Qatar happened.

title: Navjot Singh's Son Receives A Surprise Birthday Gift - From Dead Father
content: Navnoor Singh turned 22 today. This is not a happy birthday. The young man lost his father, Navjot Singh, in a tragic crash near the Delhi Cantonment metro station. The accident left his mother, Sandeep Kaur, seriously injured and hospitalised, and t

title: Centre’s support essential to mitigate impact of U.S. tariffs on exports, says Kerala Finance Minister
content: Replying to a calling attention motion in Assembly, K.N. Balagopal says he has apprised Union Finance Minister of difficulties faced by people working in various sectors in the aftermath of U.S. tariffs

title: ITI graduate, PU dropout held for running fake ID racket from cyber cafe in Bengaluru
content: The main accused would sell them to his customers for a fee ranging from ₹2,000 to ₹10,000 for fake Aadhaar cards, and ₹50,000 for educational certificates, like SSLC and PU marks cards

title: Environmental forum terms Kerala’s Wildlife Protection (Amendment) Bill, 2025 unscientific
content: Calls upon policymakers to focus on science-based solutions, habitat restoration, and coexistence strategies instead of populist shortcuts

title: Kerala Assembly: No patient under govt schemes should pay for equipment, says Health Minister Veena George
content: It is the responsibility of the heads of healthcare institutions to ensure that patients do not end up paying for equipment or medicines, she says

title: Stalker caught filming women visiting mall in north Bengaluru
content: When the women tried to catch him, the accused allegedly manhandled the duo, pushed them on the ground and tried to flee from the mall

title: Four bodies found in Pakala forest linked to a missing persons case filed in Thanjavur in Tamil Nadu
content: The bodies were found on Sunday by some sheep rearers, who ventured into the forest to graze their cattle

title: District Collector directs Kurnool officials to enumerate onion crop losses
content: She directed the officials to take up enumeration in a foolproof manner and added that the data from the ground-level will be corelated with the rainfall data and will be sent to the government

title: ESIC plans to set up medical college at Amaravati, build more hospitals in A.P.
content: Twenty medical colleges to be established in different States, says Insurance Commissioner for Information and Communication Technology T. Renuka Prasad

title: Fire Department begins safety review of schools and hospitals across Karnataka
content: Till August-end, the Karnataka State Fire and Emergency Services had audited 24,000 of the approximately 46,000 government schools in Karnataka. The survey is expected to be completed within the next two months

title: ‘Economic assault’ on Kashmir: J&K leaders flag losses due to closure of Srinagar-Jammu highway
content: Fruit-laden trucks from Kashmir have been stranded for days due to the closure of the crucial highway following heavy rains and flash floods, with growers expressing apprehensions of losses

title: Cyberattack on literary stalwart M. Leelavathy over ‘starving children of Gaza’ remark draws widespread condemnation
content: Responding to the cyberattack, Leelavathy says ‘children are just children’ and that she sees them with ‘motherly affection, no matter which country they hail from or what caste or religion they belong to’

title: Army troops undertake route march at 17,000 feet in Sikkim
content: Each soldier carried weapons, equipment, and survival gear, replicating battlefield conditions in high-altitude areas

title: Andhra Pradesh targets clearance of 1.15 crore metric tonnes of legacy waste by year-end
content: Emphasising the State’s commitment to cleanliness, sustainability, and resource efficiency, Secretary MAUD said that alongside legacy waste clearance, Waste-to-Energy projects are expanding across the State

title: Grandeur marks Koil Alwar Thirumanjanam in Tirumala
content: The traditional ritual was conducted as a prelude to the annual Brahmotsavams scheduled to begin from September 24

title: Assam NIT suspends 5 Bangladeshi students for campus violence
content: Enrolled under ICCR and SSI scholarships, these students were also expelled from the hostel for two semesters up to June 2026

title: Congress sets up election committee in Bihar to get battle ready for Assembly polls
content: The committee has 39 members and additionally all MPs, MLAs, MLCs, AICC secretaries, CWC members from Bihar would be invited as permanent invitees

title: PM Modi’s charge over ‘infiltration’ was ‘diversionary tactics’, claims Tejashwi Yadav
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav says, “I must point out that it is a bogey they had similarly raised in Jharkhand last year when Assembly polls were underway there. Now they have forgotten about that.”

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray targets BJP over India-Pakistan cricket match in Asia Cup
content: Uddhav Thackeray also targeted the Mahayuti government over its mounting debt burden of ₹9 lakh crore and referred to the launch of new schemes despite the precarious financial condition

title: Karnataka Governor returns KTCDA Amendment Bill 2025, seeks clarification from government on buffer zone around water bodies
content: Bengaluru Town Hall stated that the association is pleased to learn that the Governor has returned the amendment, which, it claims, ‘threatens the 45,000 lakes in Karnataka’

title: AIADMK leader Palaniswami calls on Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan in New Delhi
content: It has not yet been made known whether Mr. Palaniswami will use his Delhi trip to meet senior BJP leader and Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Maharashtra Advocate General Birendra Saraf resigns, cites personal reasons
content: Advocate General Saraf will, however, continue in the post till January 2026, by which time the government would have to appoint someone else as advocate general

title: 2008 Malegaon blast: Bombay HC questions ‘locus standi’ of petitioners challenging acquittal of accused
content: The Bombay High Court asked the victims’ families to explain their locus standi in the case and whether they were examined as witnesses while hearing challenge to acquittal of Pragya Singh Thakur, Lt. Col. Purohit, and five others

title: Modi government determined to wipe out drug menace from India, says Amit Shah
content: The Union Home Minister said the time has come to change the scale of action against the drug menace so that there are more successes in the coming days

title: Candidates in Kasaragod allege no timely intimation after Kerala PSC exam postponed
content: Hundreds of candidates who arrived at a test centre in Kasaragod on Tuesday morning to appear for Female Caretaker exam in Women and Child Development department left disappointed after learning that exam had been postponed

title: Supreme Court dismisses retired IPS officer's plea against quashing of summons to Abhay Chautala in defamation case
content: Punjab and Haryana HC had quashed the summoning order, observing that during the preliminary evidence led by Param Vir Rathee it was not established that Mr. Chautala had made the alleged defamatory statements

title: Air Conditioner will become the highest Greenhouse Gas (GHG)-emitting appliance in the country, shows survey
content: The survey also highlighted the need for India’s Cooling Action Plan to cut refrigerant demand by 25–30% by 2037–38

title: T.N. Electricity Ombudsman rejects NHAI’s plea for change in tariff category
content: In its petition, NHAI contended the electricity service connection has been wrongly classified under LM 51 tariff

title: Plea at Madras High Court seeks making Election Commission of India website, polling stations universally accessible to the disabled
content: Litigant Vaishnavi Jayakumar insists that ECI website must have multi-modal CAPTCHAs instead of a single image based CAPTCHA to access information

title: Supreme Court takes suo motu cognisance of discharge of industrial waste in Rajasthan's Jojari river
content: A Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta said the discharge of industrial waste, primarily from textile and other factories, in the river was affecting hundreds of villages

title: Death toll rises to 3 in Indore truck rampage
content: Two people died on the spot while more than 10 others were injured, the police said, adding the truck driver was allegedly under the influence of alcohol at the time of the incident.

title: Nitish announces interest-free education loans for those passing Class 12 exams in Bihar
content: Earlier, education loans of up to ₹4 lakh were provided at an interest rate of 4% to general male applicants, and 1% to female, differently-abled, and transgender applicants

title: Eight Meghalaya Ministers resign ahead of Cabinet reshuffle
content: The new Ministers are scheduled to be sworn in at Raj Bhavan at 5 p.m. on Tuesday, one of the officials said

title: Supreme Court order on Waqf more than a rap on knuckles of govt: Derek O'Brien
content: Even a casual observer of Parliament can outline how the BJP-led coalition is making a mockery of parliamentary procedure, says Trinamool Congress MP Derek O'Brien

title: Analysis: Supreme Court finds 2025 Waqf law paved with good intentions but pock-marked with arbitrariness
content: Supreme Court judgment on Waqf (Amendment) Act 2025 emphasises protection of constitutional right to property through due process

title: Light to moderate rain forecast for Chennai, surrounding districts
content: The RMC, Chennai had forecast rainfall till September 18 over isolated places in several districts of Tamil Nadu

title: Supreme Court Collegium recommends appointment, confirmation of Judges in five High Courts
content: In the Himachal Pradesh High Court, the Collegium approved the elevation of two senior advocates — Jiya Lal Bhardwaj and Romesh Verma — as Judges

title: Manhunt on for fourth accused in gang rape of college student near beach in Odisha's Puri
content: The incident happened around Saturday (September 13) noon, but a complaint was lodged at the Puri Sadar police station on Monday (September 15) evening

title: Elgar Parishad case: Supreme Court grants six-week interim bail to activist Mahesh Raut on medical grounds
content: Mr. Raut’s counsel apprised the top court that he has been suffering from rheumatoid arthritis and required urgent medical attention

title: Enforcement Directorate summons Robin Uthappa, Yuvraj Singh, Sonu Sood in online betting app case
content: Robin Uthappa, Yuvraj Singh and Sonu Sood have been asked to depose during the next week and get recorded their statements under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in a case linked to a platform named 1xBet

title: If only all cases are settled so expeditiously: Jairam Ramesh's dig after Supreme Court closes case against Vantara
content: If only all cases are dealt with and settled so expeditiously and categorically — of course, without this mysterious 'sealed cover' business, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Rains LIVE: Heavy rains over Himachal, Uttarakhand due to clash of easterly and westerly winds, say Meteorologists
content: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Tuesday conducted an on-site inspection of disaster-affected areas including Sahastradhara, Raipur, and other impacted localities in Dehradun

title: Registration for ragi procurement in Karnataka to start by end of September: Agriculture Minister
content: Minister for Agriculture N. Cheluvarayaswamy said that the decision was taken in consultation with the CM in the wake of problems being faced by farmers due to delay in procurement of ragi in 2024

title: Boy sexually assaulted by 14 men in Kerala for 2 years, eight arrested
content: 14 persons, including an Education department officer, an RPF official, and a political leader, booked under POCSO Act

title: Ola, Uber, Rapido get provisional licences for bike taxi services in Mumbai
content: ANI Technologies Private Limited, Uber India Systems Private Limited, and Roppen Transportation Services Private Limited, the parent companies of Ola, Uber, and Rapido, respectively, have been given approval.

title: Tatiana Suarez back on track in wide-open strawweight top 10
content: Tatiana Suarez beats Amanda lemos at Noche UFC on saturday . the 115-pound wrestler is in need of a first challenger . suarez will challenge Valentina Shevchenko for a belt on Nov. 15 .

title: Say what? 'I am ready to rock' leads top quotes from college football Week 3
content: End zone! Bryce Underwood scores 20-yard rushing touchdown. (0:26) The third week of college football brought blockbuster matchups and shocking upsets -- and memorable quotes came with it. The  Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets  were behind one notable upset, while Deion Sanders and the  Colorado Buffaloes  fell to 1-2. The  West Virginia Mountaineers  marked their first win of the latest Rich Rodriguez era. A postgame news conference in college football is always bound to create headlines of its own, and this week was no exception. Can you correctly guess who said what? See how on top of it you were during Week 3 below:

title: Indiana-Illinois and under-the-radar games in the College Football Playoff hunt
content: two teams are set to meet in front of a sold-out crowd . one team made the college football Playoff in 2024 . the other won 10 games last season, finished no. 16 in AP poll . both coaches have won championships and individual awards .

title: NFL Week 3 betting: Odds, lines and totals for every game
content: the Miami Dolphins host the Buffalo Bills on "Thursday Night Football" on tuesday . a matchup of undefeated teams will feature the New York Giants and the Kansas City Chiefs . the team is the biggest favorite on the week 3 slate .

title: Top players discuss playoff format, cheat meals, hype-up music
content: the NHL is close to being back in action for the 2025-26 season . a new collective bargaining agreement has been signed between the league and the players . "cheat meals," pregame pump-up tunes and weird equipment quirks are among the favorites .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: Week 3 Power Rankings: How all 32 teams stack up, plus takeaways on QB situations
content: tush push makes the Eagles "unstoppable" after win over the Chiefs . we stacked all 32 teams heading into week 3 of the 2025 season . quarterbacks will change in the coming weeks as five quarterbacks deal with injuries .

title: Baker Mayfield leads late drive as Buccaneers stun Texans in Houston
content: the Buccaneers beat the Texans 20-19 on "Monday Night Football" Baker Mayfield scored a game-winning touchdown drive with two minutes to go . he was flushed from the pocket and could not connect with rookie wideout Emeka Egbuka .
